data.content: When hosting a game on mobile, the Hold for Full button doesnt work because holding doesnt work in some cases - in my case on Android it selects the text of the button.

data.reasoningText:
The user is reporting a mobile UX issue where a "Hold for Full" button doesn't work on Android because long-pressing selects text instead of triggering the hold action. I need to find this button in the codebase and fix it to prevent text selection on mobile devices.

Let me search for this button first.

data.content: Now let me find the `startHoldUnlock` and `endHoldUnlock` functions:

The issue is clear: the button only uses `onMouseDown`/`onMouseUp`/`onMouseLeave` events, which don't fire on touch devices. On Android, a long press triggers text selection instead. I need to:

1. Add `onTouchStart`/`onTouchEnd`/`onTouchCancel` handlers
2. Add CSS `user-select: none` and `touch-action: manipulation` to prevent text selection and browser default touch behaviors

toolRequests.name: multi_replace_string_in_file

arguments.explanation: Fix the "Hold for Full" button to work on mobile by adding touch event handlers and preventing text selection

replacements.oldString:
<button
                onMouseDown={startHoldUnlock}
                onMouseUp={endHoldUnlock}
                onMouseLeave={endHoldUnlock}
                onKeyDown={(e) => {
                  if (e.key === 'Enter' || e.key === ' ') startHoldUnlock()
                }}
                onKeyUp={endHoldUnlock}
                className={`px-3 py-1.5 rounded-full text-sm border transition-colors ${
                  hostControlsMode === 'full'
                    ? 'bg-white/20 border-white/30'
                    : 'bg-amber-500/10 border-amber-500/40 hover:bg-amber-500/20'
                }`}
                aria-label="Hold to unlock full controls"
              >
replacements.newString:
<button
                onMouseDown={startHoldUnlock}
                onMouseUp={endHoldUnlock}
                onMouseLeave={endHoldUnlock}
                onTouchStart={(e) => { e.preventDefault(); startHoldUnlock() }}
                onTouchEnd={endHoldUnlock}
                onTouchCancel={endHoldUnlock}
                onContextMenu={(e) => e.preventDefault()}
                onKeyDown={(e) => {
                  if (e.key === 'Enter' || e.key === ' ') startHoldUnlock()
                }}
                onKeyUp={endHoldUnlock}
                className={`px-3 py-1.5 rounded-full text-sm border transition-colors select-none ${
                  hostControlsMode === 'full'
                    ? 'bg-white/20 border-white/30'
                    : 'bg-amber-500/10 border-amber-500/40 hover:bg-amber-500/20'
                }`}
                style={{ touchAction: 'manipulation', WebkitUserSelect: 'none' }}
                aria-label="Hold to unlock full controls"
              >

data.content:
Fixed. Here's what was wrong and what changed:

**Problem:** The button only had `onMouseDown`/`onMouseUp`/`onMouseLeave` handlers, which don't fire on touch devices. On Android, a long press defaults to text selection instead.

**Fix** (in [HostSession.tsx](src/pages/HostSession.tsx#L719-L739)):
- Added `onTouchStart` (with `e.preventDefault()` to suppress text selection), `onTouchEnd`, and `onTouchCancel` handlers to trigger the hold-unlock logic on mobile
- Added `onContextMenu` with `preventDefault()` to block the long-press context menu on Android
- Added Tailwind `select-none` class and inline `touchAction: 'manipulation'` / `WebkitUserSelect: 'none'` styles to prevent text selection and unwanted browser touch behaviors
